catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 580
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: jar with three incised lines around widest part; high neck, slightly flaring mouth with incised lines around outside; remnants of tan ash glaze
medium: Sue ware; stoneware with flaking ash glaze
text: Sue ware such as this jar was shaped on a wheel and fired in kilns reaching above 1800°F. Because they are easily damaged by heat, Sue-ware vessels were primarily intended for storage or decoration rather than cooking.
title: Jar
